description: This table contains information about certain types of planned orders, including orders from treatment days in treatment plans and therapy plans, and orders from clinical pathways steps.

columns.name: REGIMEN_ID
columns.description: The treatment day ID.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number that corresponds to each order block in the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: CONTACT_DT
columns.description: The contact date in external format of the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: CM_CT_OWNER_ID
columns.description: ID of the deployment owner for this contact.

columns.name: BLOCK_ID
columns.description: The ID of an order block in the treatment day in this row. In an IntraConnect environment this column contains the community ID (CID).

columns.name: BLOCK_DAT
columns.description: The contact date (DAT) of an order block in the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: BLOCK_INI
columns.description: The master file (INI) of an order block in the treatment day in this row. For example, "OTP".

columns.name: BLOCK_DURATION
columns.description: The duration of an order block in the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: BLOCK_CAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category of an order block in the treatment day in this row.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Other

columns.name: BLOCK_WAIT_AFTER
columns.description: The number of days to wait after an order block in the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: BLOCK_WAIT_FROM_C_NAME
columns.description:
The 'wait after' category of an order block in the treatment day in this row.  For example, Start or End.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Start


End

columns.name: BLOCK_MAX_LEAD
columns.description: The max lead of an order block in the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: BLOCK_MAX_LAG
columns.description: The max lag of an order block in the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: BLOCK_SOURCE
columns.description: The source ID of an order block in the treatment day in this row.

columns.name: BLOCK_OTP_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order block (patient order template) in the treatment day in this record.

columns.name: CHILD_DISPLAY_NAME
columns.description: The display name of an order block in the treatment day in this record.

columns.name: CHILD_SSC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of a non-order block in the treatment day in this record.

columns.name: CHILD_RECOMMEND_YN
columns.description:
The flag indicating if the order item is recommended with an override reason.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: CHILD_REC_OVR_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reason for deselecting the recommended item


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: CHILD_RECOM_OVR_CMT
columns.description: The comments for deselecting the recommended item

columns.name: BLOCK_SRC_DAY_UID
columns.description: Stores the unique ID of the day from which it was created.

columns.name: ORDER_RANK
columns.description: Stores the position of this order in the treatment day from the source protocol. If this order was added manually to the treatment plan after it was created, then this item will be empty.
